sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt) - can be sourced from chemical supply companies; Er (Erbium) - available from rare earth metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - obtainable from laboratory supply stores; Si (Silicon) - found in electronics or chemical suppliers; Y (Yttrium) - sourced from rare earth suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt) - can be sourced from chemical supply companies; Er (Erbium) - available from rare earth metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - obtainable from laboratory supply stores; Si (Silicon) - found in electronics or chemical suppliers; Y (Yttrium) - sourced from rare earth suppliers.

1. Weigh out 12g of cobalt powder, 1g of erbium powder, 3g of phosphorus powder, 4g of silicon powder, and 1g of yttrium powder using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all the weighed powders. 3. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure a homogeneous mixture. Mix for at least 10 minutes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 12g of cobalt powder, 1g of erbium powder, 3g of phosphorus powder, 4g of silicon powder, and 1g of yttrium powder using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all the weighed powders. 3. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure a homogeneous mixture. Mix for at least 10 minutes.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200째C (2192째F) for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200째C (2192째F) for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This may take approximately 4-6 hours, depending on the furnace specifications.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This may take approximately 4-6 hours, depending on the furnace specifications.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surface with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surface with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if necessary.
